title: Fix public header hamburger icon sizing and desktop Contact link alignment

requirements.summary: Reduce the public header hamburger icon size while preserving side panel toggle behavior across breakpoints.
acceptanceCriteria: The hamburger menu icon renders at `size-6` (or equivalent) and remains clickable/tappable to open the side panel on all breakpoints.
No layout regressions are introduced in the header height or spacing.

file_operations.description: Update the hamburger icon sizing from the current larger size to `size-6` equivalent (e.g., `h-6 w-6`) while keeping the existing button and `onToggleSidePanel` click/tap behavior unchanged and visible on all screen sizes.

requirements.summary: Align the desktop-only Contact link to the right content boundary by removing extra horizontal padding.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop breakpoints, the Contact link no longer includes `px-4` horizontal padding.
The Contact link remains hidden on mobile and visible on desktop, and still navigates to `/contacto`.
Header left/right edges align consistently with the page content container boundaries (`max-w-[1200px] px-4`).

file_operations.description: Remove the `px-4` class from the desktop-only Contact link while preserving existing typography, hover styles, and vertical padding (`py-2`), and ensure it still links to `/contacto` and remains hidden on mobile.
